intro: Nidorella pinnatifida, commonly known as the broad-leaved nidorella, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Araliaceae and is characterized by its compound leaves with a pinnate arrangement. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that are clustered in umbels, typical of its family. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in tropical rainforests. Its ornamental value makes it a sought-after plant in horticulture.
